title: Lead by example
description: It is forbidden for an Aqualitor, someone familiar with The Rules, to knowingly assist another paddler to breach them... unless it's a matter of safety. Safety always trumps The Rules, whether you're a barnacle or a frother.

title: The Ocean is Boss
description: No matter how good you think you are, the ocean is better. Anyone who says otherwise will soon be humbled by a bombie. Respect must be paid to all waters - from nuclear conditions to duck farts.

title: It's all about the craft
description: It is, absolutely, without question, unequivocally, about your vessel - be it surfski, OC, va'a, or dragon boat. Anyone who says otherwise is obviously a pond paddler.

title: Harden The Splash Up
description: Free your mind and your technique will follow. Your mind is your worst enemy in technical conditions. Do all your thinking before you leave the beach. Once you're through the break, wrap yourself in the sensations - the smell of salt, the sound of runners, the feeling of flight as your craft links waves.

title: Safety First, Glory Second
description: Unlike cycling's Rule #5 about hardening up, our ultimate rule is safety. PFDs and leashes are not optional. Your float plan is sacred. You can't paddle if you're dead, and rescue beers are expensive.

title: Equipment Respect is Mandatory
description: Your vessel must be maintained with reverence. Your rudder cables shall be properly tensioned, your bailer clear, your venturi clean. A loose cable slapping inside your hull brings shame upon your ancestors.

title: Remount Protocol
description: A clean remount is the mark of a true Aqualitor. Side saddle or cowboy, your technique must be swift and graceful. Taking more than three seconds in flat water marks you as a kook. Practice until your remounts are smoother than your excuses.

title: If you are out paddling in manky conditions, it means you are a badass
description: Period. Flat water paddling is a luxury reserved for Sunday arvo coffee runs. Those who paddle in foul weather – be it nuclear, washing machine, or liquid himalayas – are members of a special club who, upon checking multiple weather apps and seeing carnage predicted, allow a wry smile to spread across their face.

title: Beta Spray Protocol
description:
Unsolicited technique advice shall only be given when:
• The recipient is about to die
• They're using their paddle backwards
• They've specifically begged for help
• They're a close friend who won't punch you

title: The correct number of craft to own is n+1
description: While the minimum number one should own is two (stable and tippy), the correct number is n+1, where n is the number currently owned. This equation may also be re-written as s-1, where s is the number of skis owned that would result in separation from your partner. Storage location hierarchy must be observed.

title: Weather App Obsession is Sacred
description: The ritual of checking multiple weather apps is mandatory. However, trusting any single forecast completely marks you as a novice. True masters know:
list: The best conditions come when you're at work
If three apps agree, they're all wrong

title: The Bootie Beer Ceremony
description: Swimming mandates the sacred consumption of the Bootie Beer. Additionally:
list: A rescue beer must be provided to your savior
The incident must be recounted at the post-paddle coffee
Each retelling may grow slightly in wave height
Photographic evidence of the swim may only be shared with consent

title: Downwind Etiquette is Absolute
list: The paddler on the wave has right of way
Wave hogging shall result in paddling purgatory
One Lipp is worth a thousand paddle strokes

title: Know Your Conditions
list: Washing Machine = confused seas from multiple directions

title: Global Brotherhood/Sisterhood Protocol
description: Greet fellow paddlers appropriately by region:
list: When in doubt, a knowing nod will suffice

title: Coffee Protocol is Sacred
description: Post-paddle coffee stops are mandatory. Discussion topics shall follow strict hierarchy:
list: Wave height analysis (increasing with each retelling)
Next paddle planning (while still soaking wet)

title: Technical Mastery Must Be Earned
list: Catch as silent as a platypus diving
Exit clean enough to not disturb sleeping seabirds
Recovery smooth enough to shame silk
Power phase strong enough to impress barnacles
note: If your catch sounds like you're fighting the ocean, consider lawn bowls.

title: The Shuttle Dance
description: The ritual of car shuffling for a downwinder must be performed with military precision:
list: 'One more run' calculations must include retrieval time
All participants must return to correct vehicles
note: Failure results in the Walk of Shame

title: Conditions Classification Protocol
list: 'Puckery' means you should have brought the stable ski
'Growler' means big enough to get respect

title: Documentation Requirements
list: GPS tracks must be shared (after appropriate editing)
Photos must show good wave height perspective
Strava kudos must be distributed equally

title: Wave Priority Hierarchy
list: Runners must be respected and not wasted
Linking waves is an art form worthy of respect
A good hole must not be squandered
Wallowing is acceptable only if no one's watching
One PHAT Lipp (2 Lipps) shall be celebrated with appropriate reverence

title: Multi-craft Respect Protocol
description: All paddle craft shall be respected:
list: Even SUPs (though we question their life choices)
note: Each has its place in the grand scheme of water worthiness

title: The Sacred Vessel Care
list: No excess resin shall be tolerated
note: Carbon fiber maintenance is meditation

title: Fetch Evaluation Protocol
list: That one local paddler who's always right

title: The Brotherhood/Sisterhood of the Swim
note: Remember: Today them, tomorrow you

title: Classification of Paddler Types
description: Know your position in the natural order:
list: Wind Whisperer (masters of weather app interpretation)
Wave Magnet (always finds the best runs)
Car Park Captain (expert forecaster, rarely paddles)
Coffee Shop Champion (better at analysis than paddling)
note: Respect each, for you have been or will be all of these

title: The Sacred Terminology
description: Proper paddling terms shall be used:
note: Using incorrect terminology marks you as a kook

title: Local Knowledge Protocol
list: Never claim to know better than locals
note: Exception: Unless you're Oscar Chalupsky

title: The Multiple Ski Theorem
list: A stable ski for manky days
A tippy ski for showing off
A middle ski you actually use
A classic ski you'll never sell
A new ski you're hiding from your partner
note: All must be justified as 'essential safety equipment'

title: Weather-Based Excuses
description: Acceptable reasons for not paddling: Lightning within 10km, Shark feeding frenzy, Actual hurricanes. Unacceptable reasons:

title: The Technical Mastery Hierarchy
list: Power Phase (strong as a whale's tail)
note: And still accept you'll swim occasionally

title: Ghost Workshop Protocol
description: Your car shall maintain permanent readiness:
note: For the wind waits for no one

title: The Sacred Measurements
note: Never in kilometers unless explaining to non-paddlers

title: Broaching Management Protocol
list: Act like you're testing your rudder
note: Document only if spectacular enough for social media

title: The Wind Reading Ritual
list: Licking your finger and holding it up
note: The last one is just for show, but do it anyway

title: The Post-Swim Protocol
list: Adjust PFD as if checking fit
Scan horizon pretending to check conditions
Make casual comment about water temperature
Immediately plan more challenging run to restore dignity

title: Wash Riding Ethics
list: Take your turn at the front
Never be labeled WRS (Wash Riding Scum)
Share the work in a pack
Accept that karma applies to wash riding
note: Exception: During races, all ethics become flexible

title: The Sacred Vessel Storage
list: Never where neighbors can judge your addiction

title: The Technical Conditions Assessment
list: Nuclear: Call in sick to work
Victory at Sea: Notify next of kin

title: The Barnacle Respect Clause
list: They have seen more conditions than your weather apps
Their war stories are probably true
Their technique compensates for deteriorating bodies
They remember when skis were actually made of wood
They've forgotten more about paddling than you know

title: The Sacred Coffee Vessel
list: Must be strong enough to float a paddle
Provides excuse for extending paddle socializing
note: Single-origin beans preferred after epic conditions

title: The Fish Story Protocol
list: Floating plastic bags become Portuguese Man-o-War
note: All stories must end with 'but I stayed calm and kept paddling'

title: The Rudder Commandments
note: The sacred saying: 'Tight cables, clean lines, swift rudder, good times'

title: The Vessel Selection Theorem
note: Then buy one size more advanced anyway

title: The "Yeah, Nah" Principle
list: Yeah, Nah, Yeah = already on the water
Yeah = conditions are pumping but playing it cool

title: The Downwind Dance Protocol
list: 6. Arrive at launch to find conditions changed

title: The Brotherhood/Sisterhood of the Tube
note: Unless racing - then all bets are off

title: The Technical Equipment Obsession
note: All discussed while fondling new gear at local shop

title: The Seasonal Adaptation Protocol
list: Maintain superior attitude to summer-only paddlers

title: The Wind App Hierarchy
list: Local wind guru must be consulted
note: If all sources agree, be very suspicious

title: The Sacred Shuttle Timing
note: Then miss it all anyway because conditions are pumping

title: The Washing Machine Survival Protocol
list: Pretend you meant to go there
Claim you're working on rough water skills
note: Never admit to being scared

title: The Kook Prevention Protocol
list: Never claiming local status unless earned
note: Remember: We were all kooks once

title: The Ocean Giveth Principle
note: The ocean remains undefeated

title: The Surfski Specification Debate
description: Endless discussion shall be had regarding:
note: All while secretly knowing it's mostly about the paddler

title: The Universal Paddler's Paradox
list: Perfect conditions occur during work hours

title: The Sacred Time Measurements
description: Paddle time shall be measured in:
note: Never in actual clock time

title: The Bomber Protocol
note: Those who ignore bombers become cautionary tales

title: The Technical Term Translation
note: Keep it vague to avoid causing concern

title: The Equipment Care Covenant
note: Treat your vessel better than your car

title: The Paddling Wardrobe Decree
note: Board shorts in winter mark you as either hero or fool

title: The Huli Management Strategy
list: Maintain facial expression of mild interest
note: As if entire sequence was intentional

title: The Beta Distribution Protocol
note: But never spray beta without invitation

title: The Wave Priority Hierarchy
list: First on wave has right of way
note: Violation results in cosmic paddle karma

title: The Sacred Distance Rule
note: Unless racing, then kilometers are permitted

title: The Barnacle History Protocol
description: When a Barnacle speaks of past paddles:
list: Accept all wave heights as stated
note: For they paddled before GPS could prove otherwise

title: The Multi-craft Mastery
note: Each has its place in the grand scheme

title: The Liquid Himalaya Response
note: Let others speak of your accomplishments

title: The Coffee Shop Championship
note: All while dripping on coffee shop floor

title: The Technical Evolution Mandate
note: But never claim perfection, for the ocean hears all

title: The Wind Whisperer's Way
note: Weather apps are merely suggestions

title: The Paddle Selection Sacrament
note: For it is the extension of your will

title: The Dawn Patrol Principles
list: Gear must be packed night before
note: Reward: Having entire ocean to yourself

title: The Vessel Quiver Quotient
list: The Secret New Ski (hidden from partner)
note: All justified as 'essential equipment'

title: The Downwind Dictionary
list: 'Liquid Himalayas' = time to call in sick

title: The Sacred Shuttle Philosophy
list: Remember: The wind waits for no one

title: The Time on Water Theory
note: Exception: Partner's birthday (maybe)

title: The Technical terminology Protocol
description: Proper use of terms marks the true Aqualitor:
note: Misuse of terms results in coffee shop penance

title: The Fetch Appreciation Doctrine
note: All to find the perfect run

title: The Universal Remount Laws
note: Practice until muscle memory defeats panic

title: The Wave Priority Pyramid
note: Exception: Everyone equal when rescue needed

title: The Sacred Recovery Ritual
note: Recovery is preparation for next paddle

title: The Environmental Respect Code
list: No gel wrappers in the ocean
note: The ocean is our temple

title: The Multi-Generation Protocol
note: But let them learn some lessons themselves

title: The Paddling Partnership Principles
note: No paddler left behind (unless they're being difficult)

title: The Vehicle Dedication Decree
list: Never be fully cleaned of sand
note: Vehicle resale value is irrelevant

title: The Session Rating System
description: Paddle sessions shall be rated by:
note: Never by actual distance covered

title: The Wind Waiting Wisdom
list: Tell increasingly elaborate past condition stories
note: The wind gods respect dedication

title: The Universal Paddler's Truth
list: Perfect waves happen when camera's flat
Epic runs occur with no witnesses

title: The Legend Building Protocol
list: Wind speed gains 5 knots per beer
Distance grows 1 nautical mile per week
note: But never outright lie - the ocean knows

title: The Sacred Calendar Covenant
note: All followed by mandatory coffee analysis

title: The Final Philosophy
note: This is The Way
